lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome to tonight's fantastical episode of Critical Role.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Fantastical?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fantastical.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Testicular.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is. It is a testicle episode of Critical Role. Sorry for the delay. We had some technical issues as tonight we do have the wondrous Ashley Johnson joining us via Skype for this climactic episode.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Cue cut to Ashley!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yay! Hi Ashley! She's dancing for it. So sorry for the delay, but we're on here.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: We have eight different bands coming through--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Including the Beatles.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Roaches.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Oh, we're getting a looped feedback. I think we're good. And we're going to be doing a special Ant Man-themed Group Hug with a ton of giveaways coming to us from Disney to give away during the show. And then on Monday, Michele Morrow during Massive is giving away a Valve key that was sent to her and basically it unlocks every single game Valve has ever made, as well as every game they will make. So basically, you could own Half-Life 3.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a Valve golden ticket.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: It is. It's a Valve golden ticket. She's giving it away at 1:30 on Monday, so make sure to tune in for that. It's the only way to own Half-Life 3, maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are employees eligible?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Are employees eligible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically, we're not employees, but no.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can be active in the chatroom. I'll be so active in the chatroom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's currently driving here as fast as she can from The Video Game Awards, where they announced her character in Uncharted. That's awesome! Super stoked about that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Another great indie game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, no, I'm really pulling for that series.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hope it does well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hope it gets the recognition it so should get. Rises above a cult hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Starting at eight o'clock tonight. It's a little delayed due to scheduling craziness but starting at 8:00 tonight, you will be able to see Ashley Johnson's playlist for Pike on the website will be going up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's pretty rich.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an awesome one. Been listening to it for a lot of the day.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed! So that'll be going up at 8:00 tonight, and I believe mine will be going up next week. That one's been an adventure in crafting so far so I hope you guys enjoy that. Let me throw to you guys for the comic if you want to go through that real fast.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Comic went up on Wednesday.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, and last week when we weren't here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two comics.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two comics!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are you going to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where do you find those comics, guys?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can find those comics at geekandsundry.com.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, and what are they?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're awesome little four-panel weekly comic strips going through the backstory of Vox Machina at the Winter's Crest Festival.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Our first Winter's Crest Festival together running around, causing havoc, being adorable. Just in time for Christmas.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And those viewers have to pay extra to get that, don't they?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not at all, Sam!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Of course! This is all free through the Geek and Sundry website.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my goodness! Well, I'm going to click on it right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You should! After the show.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you guys. Yeah, it's actually a pretty fun arc. It's one of the more lighthearted Vox Machina background moments.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's us being cute, surrounded by all the sadness.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eight weeks of cute.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll be cute in three hours.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll be dead in three hours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't say that! You don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need photography of the 19th century over here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, dice will tell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can't wait to see the old-timey photos of our propped up dead bodies. Dressed finely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're horrible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it might be time to do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. Also, I recently found out that Obsidian had released the Pillars of Eternity soundtrack on iTunes. The same soundtrack that they let us use on our show for background. It's an awesome soundtrack, and if you're a fan of the game or if you're just a fan of good atmospheric soundtrack music, go check it out. It's on iTunes, so thank you Obsidian again!

lines.name: MARISHA, LIAM
lines.text: Thanks, Obsidian!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Critmas for this month is next week. We pushed it back a week because tonight's episode is a little crazy or it's looking to become so, depending, and we wanted to give you a little more time to get things in for Critmas for the actual holiday season. So we'll be calling it Critmas slash what was it you said, Taliesin?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, Voxanukkah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll keep them coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, this'll be our fun month event. We're excited about that. Let's see. If you want to go ahead and take the announcement--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Yes, many of you have been taking advantage of our code CRITROLE with Wyrmwood Gaming, but not all of you so the rest of you go over to Wyrmwood Gaming. If you use CRITROLE, you get free shipping for any of their beautiful boxes. Mine is Gabon ebony. It's black I really like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I hope it's Gabon. Because you already mentioned Valve at one point tonight and it's important that we all pray to Gaben together.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Put your dice in them. You'll like them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I haven't gotten to see mine in person yet, and I'm excited.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have yours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We've got to get it to you when you come back in town.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By the way, thank you for tweeting your comics today, which sent everyone into a tizzy thinking that you were here in LA.

lines.name: SAM, MATT
lines.text: Including us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know! I didn't even mean-- I just pulled them out of my suitcase today. And then some people were tweeting back and I was like, "Oh, shit. It looks like I'm at home." I was like, "Ah, well."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mass panic, it's no big deal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're technically still here. And you know what, actually right next to Travis, you guys are size appropriate for the group, so it works out well.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Really? (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hello, Pike!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait for it. "Oh hi, Grog!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh hi, Pike! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT, MARISHA
lines.text: There we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's amazing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, high five!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yay! Slowest high five ever. Awesome. Then just reminding you guys, we've got a couple more weeks before the holiday season. We got a bunch of our awesome shirts up on the website including the How Do You Want To Do This? shirt that Marisha's wearing tonight, which is apparently also selling out again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, is it sold out again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Certain sizes are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Certain sizes are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're pushing to get more in, hopefully.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Better get them while you can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And the Critmas sweater, which is delightful, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is delightful, isn't it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can also get these by donating to the Obama campaign eight years ago. Just so you know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know if they have any left but they might.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does anybody else have any announcements they want to make at this time?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am nervous.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I am so nervous.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And terrified.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm calm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect, perfect. Well, cool. That being the case, then, let's go ahead and let's go ahead and jump in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While they were down there they found a woman, apparently imprisoned, under an illusion that they revealed to be Anna Ripley. Dr. Anna Ripley, one of the torturers of Percy five years before and currently seemingly interested in the black powder based gun tech he had been developing. However, they took her captive, went upstairs, and discovered that Percy's sister, Cassandra, is indeed still alive and being held captive within the castle. In the process of trying to save her Anna Ripley got away, Cassandra got her throat cut but thankfully was saved by the quick actions of Vox Machina and the near death's door stepping of Vax once again. But nevertheless, saved her, prevented her disastrous fate--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Before anyone entered the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've all gathered yourself, taken a short rest to heal up. Whatever else you want to do to prepare at this time. You know, discussion, items, preparation, trading, anything you want to do before you delve any further into this tunnel underneath the city of Whitestone, now is the time to do so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're in the crypt? The sarcophagus sort of thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the actual official name, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival, do you know anything-- Do you know what's just ahead of us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the back wall of this mausoleum was originally just a wall. There was a large 20-foot wide cavern that is chiseled through the stonework and appears to delve deeper into the ground behind them.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We got a Laura Bailey!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's up, buddies?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Award show variant costume! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Comic-Con night on the town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right. (gasps) Hey Ashley!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, hello Laura! You look so pretty!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, that's so cool!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She can't see you there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congratulations, by the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, thank you!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I didn't win. They were unveiling my character in Uncharted tonight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you go onstage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't, no. I just sat there and then I went, "Okay, well, I've got to go!" And I got up and ran and I feel like an idiot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got Briarwoods to kill.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Briorities.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, I'm glad you could join us. Thank you for that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you say Briorities?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Briorities.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Briorities.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Taliesin!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't know if we have any further to go from this crypt? Uncharted?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's my thing! Oh, there's no drink in my--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, go quick.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do it, it's fine. We're just starting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I didn't want to touch it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've literally not had a conversation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We haven't done anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'm going to charge in! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to take a vial of holy oil that I have out of the Bag of Holding and keep it in my hand. Just out, so I don't have to get it out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog, speaking of. How many health potions do you have? I feel like we might need to redistribute.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a shitload. I never really use them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You should do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have two level awesome-- what are the biggest ones?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Greater?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's greater or superior.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have two superior, one the top one, and five of the low ones.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I take two of the low ones, possibly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Superior would be the highest you've received so far.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay then I have one of those.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am all out of tricks, just about, so may I please have a superior, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, what are you offering?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm offering safety for your facial hair for perpetuity.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope. Give me something else.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now it's in danger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How about safety for your life because we'll be having your back and whatnot?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How could you have my back if it's on me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to let that one go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will let you flick me hard, hard in the nads, should we survive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about you let me flick you hard in the nads now and I'll give you a healing potion?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we take a short rest after that? (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is happening? (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just a little one. I won't even rage or nothing. It'll just be a quick little tap on your walnut.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will do this trade.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! I kneel down and I get right up to his bits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait! I pull a stick out of my bag and I put it in my mouth and I bite down very hard on it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to use Minor Illusion to create a bull's eye right around his crotch. Concentric circles glowing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I go for-- are you right-handed?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go for the left nut. (whack)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does he throw up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, but you do take one point of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just one? It's just a ring finger but it's still a goliath.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there a little cough?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's definitely enough of a reaction to be worth your--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (hoarse) There's no sound. At all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. I will give you one of the-- there's three different levels or just the two?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you have, you have common. Sorry, the healing potion, the greater healing and the superior.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (hoarse) The good one, fucker.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll give you the greater. I give him a greater. And Percy. I like it when you turn into the giant cloud thing so you don't have to take a nutshot. Would you like a common or a greater?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, if I could steal two commons, just to be on the safe side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, okay. I give him two common.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I offer the satisfaction of Vax knowing that I got them for free.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cassandra also steps forward and says, "I myself do not have any sort of potion of "protection. Does anyone have anything which they could offer?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, hello, hi. I look like your brother but I'm shorter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, that's right. By the way, everyone is currently--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Currently everybody looks--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like either Percy or Cassandra, thanks to Scanlan's Seeming, which is really awkward.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (hoarse) Are we going to hold this up for when we go against the Briarwoods? I think it'll be confusing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, for them. You can have one of my greater healing potions. Will that suffice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Certainly, thank you." And she comes forward and reaches out towards you and you have to reach up and put it in her hand because she's reaching out towards a much taller figure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I look like a full-size Percy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A little larger. In between.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I throw her one of my commons as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have three commons, two greaters, and one superior. I'm a walking medicine cabinet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That is you, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's me, yes, what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vex, if you, if you look like Cassandra, you could conceivably get in front of the Briarwoods without them knowing that it's an enemy for a moment. Maybe long enough to fire off one of your-- don't you have some sort of sunbeam arrow or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have no sunbeam arrow, but I would like to dip some arrows in some holy oil at this moment in time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do have potentially an exploding holy arrow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That would be pretty baller.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is this the one with the question mark?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, this is a normal one, and then I have a question mark, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to dip them both?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck yes, I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay. You have two more uses of your holy oil, I believe, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Well, no. Each thing takes three arrows, so I can do six arrows altogether.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're using it all right now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Will it wear off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It lasts for an hour.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we going to get there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. We could fight them in five minutes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to do it right before we walk in the room, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's up to you. You can hold off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't see a ziggurat yet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's start making our way down there, and I can't believe I'm going to say this, but we'll have Vax scout ahead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't do anything!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't do anything. Look. Don't touch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you remember the new password?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which is?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there something different?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it Candyland? No, I don't remember.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's now "Jenga, one one-thousand, two one-thousand, three one-thousand, four "one-thousand, five one-thousand, six one-thousand, seven one-thousand, eight one-thousand, nine "one-thousand, ten."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just got flicked in the nuts. I'm not doing that. I'll say jenga.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then wait.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'll wait. So long as no more of your siblings are in danger. I did do it for reasons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know because I told you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. I consider the matter settled.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know exactly what was going to happen, but I saw a blade against your sister's throat. I would hope you would do the same for my sister if you were to see the same thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course he would.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But mostly because I fear her.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, back me up. If you were to turn into some sort of three-horned beast and go running into a house full of enemies, we would give him a similar talking-to, correct?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That would never happen. I'm more measured than all of you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't actually believe that he will listen to sense.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We just can't waste our breath, really.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, shut up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Attunement. How long does that take?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A short rest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to be a very complicated evening.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we take a short rest?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We just did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We did?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we did!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you wanted to attune to something during that short rest, you can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I attune to Boots of Levitation?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you'd like to, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We just rested for 30 minutes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roughly 30 minutes, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How would everyone feel about another seven and a half hours?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can't sleep in this--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Our meal is still active, as well. We need the benefits of that. Plus, there is a rebellion going on. It's been, what, an hour? Two hours? They're probably mostly dead by now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's possibly very true, actually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cassandra?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In your opinion, who's the more dangerous target?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The two of them together are driven-- more so than the affiliation to this Whispered One they "talk of, they're driven by one thing, and that's their affection for each other. As long as they "are together, who knows what they're capable of."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we split them up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we've got to divide and conquer this shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cassandra.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Has there been any instance where the two have separated in the recent months, that you can imagine or remember?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Most of the ziggurat construction happens during the evening, when Sylas is not resting. And "for the most part they journey together-- for the past month, at least. No, I haven't seen them "apart, really."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you think of any reason why they would separate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not unless something in the sun required their attention."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Something sudden that required their attention.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "In the sun."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In the sun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sylas does not appear to like being outside."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, one thing. Do we want to take the battle to them down here? Or do we want to try and lure them outside?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we would definitely prefer them outside, but what would draw them out? I do not know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we used Seeming and made one of us seem like Lady Briarwood?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think they would see through that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They saw through the disguise at the table back in Emon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just to point this out before we go in and kill ourselves. We have evidence now. We could abandon this whole thing. Go back and fight our day in court.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to see what they're building down there. And I worry that it would be dangerous.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus, we'd just abandon this entire revolution that we caused?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus, Uriel is suspect now. He's been corrupted; he is not trustworthy. There's no point going back to him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't leave again until this is taken care of.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Right, that was a stupid suggestion, Keyleth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keyleth, come on, we've got to stay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're all Seemed differently; it's very strange.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm really disappointed, Keyleth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For signs of corruption or control. I want to believe you are in control of your faculties. I do not fully trust you are and I think, just letting you know that a knife could hit your back as soon as the slightest misstep happened, is maybe enough to ensure some safety for this group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And were I in your position, "would think the same."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: According to Percival, they filled you with arrows. What happened?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They didn't know I was alive, either. I guess they saw the importance of keeping me under their lock "and key as a way of crushing whatever hope those who still lived here had."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why not hang you from that tree in the center of town like they did so many others?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Try and gather details of this construct they're working on beneath the city and feed this "information to those who I knew were still true and behind the de Rolo family name. I don't know "what I can say to offer you more than that."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think there's anything you can say.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) Can I insight check her?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want you back in my friend's life, but I'm sorry, I do not trust you. And I and the others will be watching.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is nothing that belies any deceit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Onward.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And upward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we going to try and separate these two? Is that the plan?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're going to take the lay of the land first. See what we're up against.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not a bad idea with Cass, but we'll see.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vax?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so I'm going to go ahead through the hole.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I stealth with you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, you're very good at that now because of my gift to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey, there you go. You guys are both going to stealth ahead? Twins, side by side. All right, go ahead and roll stealth checks. You get advantage, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get advantage because of the gold dress.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The sparkles are magical.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Magic sparkles.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It does look like mithril, doesn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The two of you go ahead. Can I have a marching order here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Him first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Me first, yeah. Her dress sparkles too much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket stays with the rest of the party, I assume.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, Trinket stays.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Who's going to be towards the front of this traveling pack?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're going way ahead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, but everyone else is following behind, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll be in the front. Meat shield.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will be right behind the meat shield.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will be right behind the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percy number four.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket follows Percy. He's following Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Trinket's following Percy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Following up the ranks with Trinket, I guess.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The crest of Sarenrae that's been stitched into your glove is now pulsing with an energy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hi, Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you hear for a second, call out, Pike's voice ring through the darkness, and you see before you, out of the shadow, out of the blackness that is before you in the cavern, a small gnomish hand reach out for you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are you all still there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take her hand. I take your hand, Pike, and I kneel down, and I press the back of her hand to my forehead and hold it there for a moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you do, the glow from the glove begins to spread from your hand across, and all of you guys see materializing out of the darkness Pike's form slowly unravel into this shadowed area into this glowing beacon of her holy form that you previously traveled with, as Pike is now once again brought to this point of clarity here beneath the castle Whitestone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I run over and I knock Vax out of the way and I pick up Pike and give her a big hug.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My nut!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, Pike, I'm so glad to see you!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Grog, but you don't look like Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? Oh. No. (whispers) It's me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is everybody Percy and Cassandra?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Except for you, darling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's very weird. You're a tiny gnome in armor, and everyone else looks like Percy and a woman you've never seen before in your life.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bear-Percy is especially disturbing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. This giant rotund Percy on his hands and legs, just (bear noises).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is awkward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a very strange visual, and you're very confused momentarily.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I give Percy-Trink some ear scratches.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He likes it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (bear noises)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I run over and I say, Pike, Pike, what happened, you disappeared before, but now you're back. Are you here to stay? What's going on?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's very hard to stay in this form, especially when this place is very dark, and sometimes I just get pulled away, so I'm going to stay as long as I can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're so happy to have you here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So happy to have you here.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm so happy to be here. How are you, how are you guys, are you okay, where are you at in terms of health?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're all healthy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vax is minus a hit point because I hit him in the nuts. Hah!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs) Oh, Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we have a new member. Well, a new traveling companion. This is Cassandra.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cassandra de Rolo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The actual Cassandra.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I go over and put my hand out and hold her hand and say, it's so very nice to finally meet you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pleasure to meet you, young gnome." Which is funny coming from her, because she's technically younger than you. She looks hardened, but she's younger than you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. Shall we?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now that we're together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shall we keep moving?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now we're definitely going to kick some ass.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With Pike with us, we can do anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is she glowing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike is giving low candlelight around her, so you're going to want to keep her towards the back, probably.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Even when she's a ghostly form.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we hang a sheet over her or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, it'll be like throwing a t-shirt over your bedroom light. It'll just be a nice atmospheric Chinese lantern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, mood lighting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I place my Sarenrae hand on her shoulder and say, you're here because she willed you to be here, she knows that we need you. Now please hide behind obese Percival. And I pat my sister on the shoulder and head back into the darkness.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cassandra's going to be right there. Flying V formation. And you guys continue down this tunnel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Check for traps.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Perception all that shit down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, perception. Oh yeah, I should do it too. Hold on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 20 for me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I know, right? 18 for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys continue on this slowly descending tunnel for about ten minutes or so before you see it divide to the left very heavily and then continue forward. There's still no light source here and so you're relying on your darkvision to continue, but there's the switchback to the left and the one that continues forward.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I lean over to my sister and say, I'm not going to do anything, I'm just going to look 50 feet down--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How about wait a fucking second and let me look for footprints?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look for footprints?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can. Make a survival check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I don't know which one to use. I'm so nervous. Okay, let's do this one. That was a bad one. I'm perceptioning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a survival.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Well, it's the same. That is a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You actually pull out a small bit of torch pith and light it a bit just to get a little light across this one intersection briefly. There are footprints back and forth in all ways, but many of them have been, at least the footprints coming from, and the last footprints were coming from this tunnel to your immediate left, were from a while back. The fresher footprints, fresh as of four hours, continue on down that way. You do notice that the smell of the air itself is, you notice this as well as you're inspecting, the air down here has a very acrid, sharp scent anyway, a hint of chemical. It seems to be getting stronger to the left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Briarwoods. Briarwoods?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Continuing to push forward, about another five minutes or so, keeping track of your distance to the castle you're starting to get towards the outside perimeter of the actual city itself. As you're keeping tabs on distance traveled to that area, you catch, based on your last perception roll, there is a portion of the floor that seems to have some placed crooked chunks of stone. You see pieces of broken stone here and there, things that have fallen out from being hauled from the distant dig into wherever the ziggurat is, but there's one section where it appears there's platforms.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Looks a little hinky?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like it's deliberately placed, as opposed to dropped and left there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to carefully approach and disarm anything I can detect or find.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make a check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that thieves' tools?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's thieves' tools, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You find two of the large stone slabs that are part of this discarded sequence here, they have beneath them some small magical burst that is waiting to detonate. You manage to mark it and take a couple of other stone pieces to wedge underneath it to prevent it from depressing onto whatever the trigger may be, and note to the rest of the party to avoid that section.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a couple of stones here that I've marked in the middle of the path. Don't step on them, please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Copy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Somebody tell Trinket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And Pike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He fucking understands signs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be in charge of guiding Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He listens to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The awkward large bear-Percy--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They got the message.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's still my friend. At least the bear still loves me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You continue forward for another I'd say 20 minutes. Go ahead and make another perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 21. Again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Both of you guys, walking forward, both step out and look down just in time to stop your foot from pressing onto what looks to be a mound of dirt that is, once again, deliberately placed and a little more fresh than the rest of the dust-covered hallway. You can see there's an area that is distinctly a different shade of color based on the lack of dust on top of it, and you both stop just in time. Thank you very much. I got fries.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I give her the universal rogue movement for scoot back. Yeah, keep going. Ten feet or so. All right. I'm going to inspect and try to do the same. 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You approach this mound and as soon as you get close to it, you pull out your tools. You're not quite sure how this initially works. And as you begin to push slightly on the dirt on one side, you can see the other side shifts a little bit from the weight. It's like there's something beneath the dirt that has some sort of shifting property to it and you gather based on the way it reacted there is a gas contained beneath this. To disarm it would be difficult, but you can ascertain the nature of its detonation and once again, you can mark this to not be placed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does it take the whole passage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's right in the center, so it can be bypassed if you stick directly to the right or left and work along the sides. Trinket may be a little difficult to work on, but we'll make a roll for that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What could possibly go wrong?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right people, we have some gas trapped under a mound of shit up here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Some gas?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah it smells like Grog, so avoid it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Something bad. I'm going to stay here, I'd like you all to bring up the rear, and Kiki, bring the bear. Bring my nephew up, and I'd like everyone to pass ahead, and my sister and I will get Trinket up behind you all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a question. How are we marking these traps?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This one I'm just standing in front of.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're coming across a lot of these. If we need to make a quick escape, it might be a problem.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we're going back out the way we came in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In a hurry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll just have to remember.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hopefully, we won't be in a hurry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well we'll just have Trinket run first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sure you've got something in that bag of yours that we can plop in front of this. For now, let's just get past it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you each make your way around this. When it comes to Trinket's side, I'll say for you because he'll probably need a little help making his way across so go ahead and just make a dexterity check for Trinket with advantage, with the aid from the party.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, that's not good. Eight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight? Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nope!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's for Trinket?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so who's helping Trinket?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am. We are, I assume.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll help Trinket.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll also say, if this was a gas trap, I would probably throw my mask on before passing it, as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll help Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so just you, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's pushing up the side of the cavern, claws scraping on the side of the wall. Foot slips, slams into the mound of dirt, at which point, the mound depresses and then (explosion) bursts open into a 20 by 20-foot gas cloud.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I cast Gust of Wind really quick and push it back down the hallway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can start doing that because it is a lingering cloud effect. Regardless, I need you and Trinket to both make a constitution save.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! 21! Nope, 20

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Laura, can you roll a constitution save for Trinket?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (nervous laugh) Yeah--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just regular?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just a regular constitution save.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven? Okay. You suffer six points of poison damage, Trinket suffers 12 points of poison damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, you suffer no poison damage. We had our meal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Heroes' Feast!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Trinket ate it, too!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're immune to poison?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're immune to fear and poison.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) That's amazing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the cloud begins to fill the area, you breathe it in and there's that reactionary point of like, "Shit, get Trinket out of there!" and then you realize the harshness of the toxin doesn't seem to be affecting your system. There is some element of the "holy shit it's delicious" feast you guys had that is keeping the toxins at bay from entering your system.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, doesn't your belt of Dwarvenkind have something like that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No? Okay, never mind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He just grows a beard. You have advantage on charisma?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have resistance against poison damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have advantage on persuasion checks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take half poison damage whenever you do take poison damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, where did Pike go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No Pike! The evil of this place is making it hard to maintain her connection.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know it's hard. It's deep underground.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We live in an age of miracles and wonders.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys pass under this cloud, you--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The connection is just not very strong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, you push the toxin cloud back and hit it off to the side, pushing it down the same tunnel that the acid section was. It'll take you a while to get it back there, but you can just leave it lingering in the tunnel if you'd like.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it's fine. I'll just leave it. It's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It seems to be pervasive for now. It may eventually fade or sink into the earth, but it'll take a while for that to happen. But you move past this trap. You continue forward and the descent grows steadily more and more steep at this point. What was like a relative decline has now gotten to the point where some of you have to get up against the wall as you step down, not to the point where it's slide-worthy or anything, but enough where it gets a little precarious for those who don't have quite as much a grand hold on loose earth. About five minutes of this, it evens out though, and as it does you come to a metallic doorway.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: God damn doors.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Please just do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Inspect it for traps!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, let him take it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't I look, and then Scanlan can handle it? I'm just going to look, all right? Yeah, 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The door does not appear to be trapped, but it is locked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you pick it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Metal door, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The surface is semi-smooth but it does have a bit of a warp to it from when the metal was originally plied and used to create this doorway, so it has this hammered look across its entire surface, some small rivets in the side. You do notice that there is no handle for it but on the other side of the door, there is something that is latched over it, so using your dagger, you manage to lift it slightly and then shove forward through the slight edge of the door frame to the door itself or means to force this off of its latch and you hear the metallic arm bang against the other side of the door as it falls down, and the door pushes open slightly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't push it that far, only like four or five inches just to peer through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That same acrid smell that has permeated into the hallway continues into this room, it's a little colder; the temperature in this room is because, as you notice, looking in, what little bit of distance you can see in this pitch black vicinity, the entire room is made of this type of hammered bronze.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Before we go in, are there any bits of whitestone on the ground, like stuff in chunks or small pieces or is it pretty clean-ish?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any of the larger pieces seem to have made their way all the way back to the undercroft where you guys had the ghost battle. At this point, you've just seen bits and pieces that may have fallen out of whatever carts were brought through and you do see grooves in the ground where like large wheeled carts were pushed back and forth up and down this tunnel to carry materials to and from.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull the door a little bit shut behind me and turn to the group and say, this is a room made entirely of metal that presumably did not exist five years ago. I think this is probably bad. Sister, dear, would you help me look? Just from the door, please? Just look.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scanlan, just shoot a lightning bolt in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, in a moment. Please. And perception check the room from here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good, that's better than mine, but not much. 23?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Question mark?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: and there appears to be a door on the opposite side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I do an arcana check, or something, to see if it's magic?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're just able to see a little bit of the edge of your visual distance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How big is the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking at the door, if you open it up? It's about two inches thick.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike, Keyleth, will you come up here? We're a little out of our depths here. This seems suspect to me. I'd like you to both have a look.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, something's going on here.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So Pike and I are going up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go. Tell us what's up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have you guys all moved up to the door, at least? Or are you all still back in the corridor?

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm moving up to the door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm stepping a little back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Cassandra does say, "This is as far as I've gone down here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know what's on the other side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I assume the project. The last time I came here, I was following the Briarwoods at a "distance. They went in there with a handful of guards, and when I made it to this door, it was "empty on the inside. I assume they traveled through that far door, but I have not actually "been here myself. It was at that point that I was discovered and dragged back to the castle."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did you make it to the acid pits?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I did not want to get too close. They're just "larger, stone troughs that these chemicals have been refined in, and for whatever purpose they've "required them, have been kept there. Dr. Ripley, actually, was in charge of a lot of that "development and creation."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy and Cassandra, does this material mean anything to you? The bronze? Does it keep any type of energy out? Why build a room out of bronze?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a question for you, as well, Percival.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know. I would like to get a better look. Are there markings on the walls? Is there any scripting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Get that out of the way. Nine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you step into the room and look along the walls at the top of the ramp that leads downward, there's no discerning features that you can glance off visually across the walls. Hammered bronze with bronze bars across to keep all the various plates that were put up together. It's not one solid piece, it's multiple sheets that were all bolted and put together to create solid walls.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And the floor is bronze?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The floor is bronze, as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The roof?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The roof is not bronze. The roof is what looks like solid whitestone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That don't look good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike, Keyleth, do you make anything of this?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anyone want to go touch a wall?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't even know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have no knowledge of--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not great with magic. I'm great with nature, and I'm not great with dungeoneering or anything like that, either. Can I do some sort of nature check to see if this is a quarry that we just walked into?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A conductor?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A conductor, yeah. It's not really a nature thing, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Not my forte. Oh, natural 20!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a beautiful thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. This bronze-colored material, and you're not too familiar with a lot of metals, but it appears to be an alloy of some kind. It would probably be a good conductor of electricity, if utilized in a way, for whatever purpose you're unable to ascertain, but this metal is not indigenous to this region, meaning the whole area of Tal'Dorei. This metal is usually imported from distant lands. It is not found or created naturally in this area, to your knowledge.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And would I gather any information on the purpose of this room and what it's used for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not with your experience, no. Gathering about, though, as you all gather in this area and are looking around, you notice that the stonework on the ceiling has two discolorations. Across the top of the ramp above you, there is a one-inch discoloration, almost like there's a drawn line across the stone. At that height and this lack of light, can't tell if it's just a marking or an actual change in material, and there's one on the other side of the room across the way at the top of the other ramp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a conductor room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, we're too far away to see what it's made out of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this distance and in this low light, it's hard to tell. You can see that there's a discoloration or change, but it is a consistent band across the top.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we send some light up there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How high are the ceilings?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I see it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What darkvision is, it's very black and white. You don't see a lot of color, and it's hard at this distance to make out anything. Without feeling it or seeing it, it's hard to get details.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I checked the door, but I didn't check anything else. Can I check the room for traps?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if you'd like to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to. Rolled a 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you descend the ramp, keeping a very close eye on the ground around you, or are you just doing a visual scan?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll walk up within a foot of the first line you referenced.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see what looks like a small almost oval-type smooth button. Or some sort of a strange object that is embedded in the floor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I try to shoot it? When none of us are in the room?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That will probably tell us what this room is about. I worry a little about alerting people on the other side of the room, but it feels dangerous to go through here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh man.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's no vents? There's no ventilation shaft, there's nothing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The roof is flat, or is it coned?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a giant box, it's just the walls and the floor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whitestone ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The whitestone ceiling and the rest of it is all this bronze material with a ramp that goes down towards the bottom and the ramp that goes on the other end, with the two platforms, where you enter and where the other door across the way is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, can we clear out and I'll try to shoot it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: See what happens.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'll do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So all of you step back out into the hallway, your cluster of Percys and Cassandras.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I step one foot behind Cassandra Number Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and pull your arrow. You aim carefully from just outside the doorway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You've got this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I add my attack to it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you add your attack bonus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On point. It strikes whatever this strange object is embedded in the floor. It hits and slightly ricochets and splinters as an arrow would when it hits a hard surface. No seeming reaction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It did nothing!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try something. First of all, does the construct of this at all remind me of anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, actually. Most of this tunnel structure did not exist when you lived here. This has all been either re-discovered or created since you left Whitestone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take my sword and I'm going to go into the room and I'm going to lay my sword on the ground. Copper is a conductor. I'm having that thought. I'm going to try and slide my sword towards the center of the room and see if I can cause a short. With the piece of metal and get a positive and negative charge to hit and see if I can get a reaction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. As you step down to the bottom of the slope as it meets the bottom, and there is an open area in the center of the floor now, about a 20-foot area width between the two ramps. You're now at the bottom of the ramp. You take the sword and you let it scatter across. And there are imperfections in the floor so it skips as it moves and such and eventually slides to a stop. No effect. But you do get a better look at what this thing is embedded in the floor. You not having darkvision, though, you would have to have a light source for this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had a torch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You bring your torch forward and you look over. It looks like a smooth gem, like an opal or some sort of whitish opaque gem that is embedded in the ground in the center.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And it's not translucent? It's like an opal-like stone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an opal-like stone, about that big that is embedded in the bronze floor. There's actually a small, metal bronze band that encases it, wraps around it that-- It wasn't just pressed into it; it was put there intentionally.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I say we smash it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: See what happens.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you disarm it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All of those sound like bad ideas.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Terrible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does anybody have a good idea?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we just walk past it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm with Scanlan. I say we just go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In the absence of good ideas, bad ideas, I think, are always reasonable.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But maybe mine and Scanlan's is a good idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Some of us stay on one side, some other people go through and see what happens to the first person.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So long as you all will pick me up off the floor, I would like to skirt the entire side of the room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And just go through the other door?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: See if I can make it to the other door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Please help me if I fall down. And I start along.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: After a good giggle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the floor ramps down towards the center, you follow it along the wall. Making your way across, looking. You notice as you go across the wall, there are three more of these same opal stones embedded in the wall about shoulder height.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the wall as you go across.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it one in the middle and then one in the center of each wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On just on your wall--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just on my wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just on your wall, there's three along the way. There's one in the center of the room in line with the central opal, and there's two to the sides of it about four feet from each other.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've gone into a crouch, so I'm very low, butt dragging along the floor and just sort of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you notice that. You skirt underneath.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Leaning my back against the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. They pass overhead. As you make your way underneath the three opals in this part of the wall. Making your way up the other ramp to the other side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Continued perception check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You make your way up this side looking about on the floor. Nothing seems to happen, nothing catches your eye. You get onto this upper platform, and there is the door there in front of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I check for traps on the door. That is a 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door does not appear to be trapped.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or locked?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does not appear to be locked. It does not seem to have a mechanism for opening other than if you wanted to try and push.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Go through it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What would they need this for? This has some sort of use for their magic. This is not a trap room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should try to remove one of the stones.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Question. Are the stones mathematically adjacent to each other? Do they appear to be lined up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well as you can tell, there's the one in the center of the middle of the floor. Then there's one on the wall that he walked across, and as you to the other wall, there are another matching set of three on both walls.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And they're all lined up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And they're all lined up. There's the two in the center of the room that match the one in the floor and then there's one to each side of that about four feet apart.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any on the ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking up. Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was going to look to see if there was one matching the one on the floor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's good metal! Good craftsmanship, damn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that's good, that's a 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking up, no. The ceiling is just smooth whitestone. You, pushing the door-- it doesn't open. It is solid stone, and as you push and look, you can see there's no hinges. Looking at where it meets the wall, it looks like it slid down into a groove. It's actually a door that would lift or sink. It slides. Some way, shape, or form, it slides into place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog doesn't have an earring, does he?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we all have earrings right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's right there! Just fucking talk to him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's across an 80-foot room! I'm not going to shout down here. There's a big heavy thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you think you could shimmy along on your tummy, along a side wall? Don't stand up because there's gems in the walls along the way and I don't know what they do, so stay low, please? And come meet me up here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I just kinda want to walk across the room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I walk across the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you watch in horror as Grog just strolls full, upright back, hammer in his arm with a big grin on his face. Looking like a really burly Percy. I have to keep reminding myself. It's a very curious visual every time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I adjust my amazing spectacles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seeming no effect. Makes his way up the ramp to where you are on the opposite side of the room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to go get my sword.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, hang on, while Grog goes and lifts the thing. While Grog does that, do I have any idea where we are geographically in the city, underground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping track best you can, you gather you're about a quarter-mile from the center of the city, from the square where the Sun Tree is. It's a quarter-mile south of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So probably not under the Sun Tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Walking up to the door, does it look like I can get any purchase with my little finger-bits?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. It is flush with the ground.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a pickaxe that I picked up before we left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I swing it at the bottom and try and find some purchase under the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could try. Yeah, go ahead. Go ahead and roll an athletics check to see if you can manage to get anything in there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. 16?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. Fuck. Nine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine? You swing with the pickaxe downward for a full angry Grog-swing, and as you hit, you feel the pickaxe move further than it did before, and for a split-second your brain's like, great! And then you look down and notice that the actual handle of the pickaxe has shattered from the impact, broken in two.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not thinking about this clearly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thinking?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've been beaten by doors before, but goddamn it, we're not going to be beaten today. I go to the center of the room and I find that little button thing and I'm going to press it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You go and press your thumb down on it. It doesn't move, it doesn't shift. It doesn't give way at all, it just stays in place. As you pull your thumb away, though, you notice that the gem has a very soft, faint white glow to it, and a second after you pull your thumb away it fades back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I walk over to the wall and touch one of the other gems.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I touch another one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I touch another one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys all place your hands against the opals on the sides, and checking as you pull your hand away, the opals glow brightly white again, and then fade.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am Captain Planet. No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Touch one of the stones, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I run over and touch a stone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I touch one, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) All right, so that's three on one side, three on the other, who's got the middle one? You got the middle one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm in the middle.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I got one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, can Trinket touch a stone? Or Cassandra. Cassandra, make yourself useful for Christ's sake.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who's Christ?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My friend back in Gnomolia, where I'm from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike, are you grabbing a stone or not?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What was that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you touching a stone or not?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That's seven. So three on one side, three on the other, Trinket keeping there with anticipation up next to you. Pike, you put your hand on the final stone. A moment passes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is totally going to work.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't seem to have an immediate effect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, maybe if we all think about the strength of our friendship and bond together.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is our time now!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we should swap out Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Pike, as you pull your hand away, the stone is glowing. And it fades momentarily after you put your hand there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it does work. Never mind, Pike. I love you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But are there any on the ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing on the ceiling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we see any missing ones?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. Okay. Looking about, Cassandra actually, who's up towards the far ramp, seems to notice something and walks up to where the door is, looking at the foot of the door. She moves her hand out of the way and presses her hand down on a hidden eighth opal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point there's a shift, a sound of stone shifting loudly, and those bars across the ceiling, the green bars? Let loose a bit of dust, and two large walls of green glass (impact noise) slam downward to the front and back of you, locking all seven of you into the center of this bronze room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where's Cassandra?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cassandra's on the other side of the green wall on the far end of the room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we hear each other through the glass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cassandra runs up to the glass and puts her hands to it, and you can hear her voice saying, "Is everyone all right?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is she on the other side of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She went up to the far platform. Which, by the way, you notice immediately, this glass, this weird, warped glass that forms these walls is the same material as the shards of green glass that you found broken on parts of the ground in the Undercroft.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, can you hit it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Anybody have any objections?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I swing away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Cassandra takes a step back, go ahead and roll for an attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is the door opening behind her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door is opening, actually, behind her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? You go ahead and you strike forward. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16. Okay. You strike with all your might across the front of the glass, Cassandra steps back as the might of it hits. A streak of green sparks fly off the edge of the blade as it careens across the front and goes (metal noises) leaving bare but a scratch across the stone. At this point, you guys see the door opening behind Cassandra, and two figures step in behind her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Goddamn it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to go ahead and cast Thunderwave. Maybe this shit can only be taken down with magic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, but are you going to hurt us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I dip my arrows in holy oil. Three of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it's just a push spell, but it's radiant damage thing. But you guys are behind the glass.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all in the glass.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're all in the glass.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we're in a closed space.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're all going to get hit by what you're doing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, if it breaks the glass, we won't be separated by glass.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Might as well die one way or another.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You wanted me to try and get us--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just do it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While all this is happening, I pull the vial of poison that I traded from that hag and start to drip it down onto my blade of life-stealing behind the group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys all gather back and up at this point, Grog, I don't know if you're still swinging?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, I'm just (angry noises).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this is happening, are you preparing Thunderwave? You said you wanted to try?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do it. You said you wanted to do it, just do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See if I can shatter this glass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a loud sound-blast echoing through the room, you can hear the reverberation of the actual bronze material sending back the vibrations of this spell. All of you who weren't covering your ears very heartily, it still creeps through and rings your head a little bit. As the blast hits the glass, it seems to have no effect. The actual essence of the spell itself is scattered across its surface. This residuum-sealed green glass. The two figures step into what little bit of light is now visible from Percy's torch that is twisted through the warped surface of this glass wall, and you see before you Lord and Lady Briarwood stepping up to the wall, looking through, their warped visage through the glass looking down into the chamber that you're all currently locked in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, is this your room? I didn't even realize we were in your house right now. How good to see you again, darling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Rather unfortunate, really."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now, the door's open behind them, right? If I use perception, do I see anything behind them, any switch or lever or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. Looking across the way, but barely able to peer past them with very little light in the distortion of the glass, you can see what seems to be some sort of a smooth stone placard that's embedded in the wall just on the other side of the door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just outside the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then I pull the cape around me and I Dimension Door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Outside that door, right by the placard, and jam my hand on that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You, all of a sudden, vanish from that room, and you press your hand into that placard. You can notice, Sylas looks over his shoulder with a slight look of unexpected surprise. The smile's still across his face.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I go ahead and start conjuring Sunbeam?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't really hold it in place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pressed the platform in-- (Skype noise)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keep going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you push in, there's a sound of grinding stone again. However, the walls stay in place. Two of the highest bronze plates that are pressed against the wall shift inside and move out of the way. And two big tubes push outward. Sylas looks over his shoulder and says, "Well, I was not "expecting you to want to see your friends dissolved quite so quickly, but certainly."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, we're going to die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys look up, this green viscous liquid begins to pour--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I stop, I pull out the gun, and the second those hit-- I've seen this coming, because fucking copper room, fucking acid. Ice shot to the one tube, do my best to reload as quickly as I can and ice shot to the other. I'm going to try and clog them with ice, at least temporarily.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make your first shot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 15. 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27. Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To hit. And that's ten plus three points of ice damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The bullet slams into the bottom of this tube, and the tube itself is not made of any real thick material; it's a similar material to the bronze the rest of this room is constructed in, and it seems like it's brought in by some sort of mechanism that locks into place.
